Tidy Fun

When presenting statistical results, don’t rely on the default computer output. Do this instead.
statistical analysis
presentation
Author

Paw Hansen

Published

February 28, 2024

Sitting at a cafe feeling like doing some data analysis. So, let’s have a look at a recent Tidy Tuesday dataset and see if we can make some fun out of it.

Packages used in this post 
library(tidyverse)
library(broom)
library(modelsummary)
library(marginaleffects)
library(estimatr)
library(ggsci)
library(gt)

theme_set(theme_minimal(base_size = 12))

Import

Code 
data("mtcars")

mtcars <- 
  mtcars |> 
  mutate(cyl = as.factor(cyl))

EDA

More cylinders, more horsepowers is bad for fuel efficiency.

Code 
mtcars |> 
  ggplot(aes(hp, mpg)) + 
  geom_point()

Code 
mtcars |> 
  ggplot(aes(as.factor(cyl), mpg)) + 
  geom_boxplot(aes(fill = as.factor(cyl))) +
  scale_fill_futurama()

Code 
mtcars |> 
  ggplot(aes(as.factor(cyl), mpg)) + 
  geom_jitter(aes(color = as.factor(cyl))) +
  scale_color_futurama()

Model

Code 
mod  <- 
  lm_robust(mpg ~ hp + disp + cyl, 
            data = mtcars)
  
mod_fixed <- 
  lm_robust(mpg ~ hp + disp, 
            fixed_effects = ~ cyl, 
            data = mtcars)
  

coef_names <- 
  c("hp" = "Gross horsepower",
    "disp" = "Displacement",
    "(Intercept)" = "Intercept")

modelsummary(model = list(
             "Without FE" = mod,
             "Fixed Effects" = mod_fixed), 
             fmt = 3, 
             stars = TRUE, 
             gof_map = c("rmse", "r.squared", "nobs"),
             coef_map = coef_names)
Without FE Fixed Effects
Gross horsepower −0.021+ −0.021+
(0.011) (0.011)
Displacement −0.026** −0.026**
(0.009) (0.009)
Intercept 31.148***
(1.775)
RMSE 2.65 2.65
R2 0.800 0.800
Num.Obs. 32 32
+ p < 0.1, * p < 0.05, ** p < 0.01, *** p < 0.001

Communicate

Code 
predictions(mod, newdata = datagrid(hp = c(100, 110, 120),
                                    cyl = c(4, 6, 8)),
            by = "cyl") |>   
  gt() |> 
   fmt_number(
    decimals = 1,
    use_seps = FALSE
  ) |> 
    cols_label(
    cyl = "Cylinder"
  )
Cylinder estimate std.error statistic p.value s.value conf.low conf.high
4 22.8 1.5 15.1 0.0 169.0 19.9 25.8
6 18.8 0.9 20.1 0.0 294.7 16.9 20.6
8 20.4 1.7 12.0 0.0 107.8 17.1 23.7
Code 
avg_comparisons(mod, variables = "cyl")

Code 
avg_slopes(mod, newdata = datagrid(hp = c(100, 110, 120),
                                    cyl = c(4, 6, 8)))
